body_html:
I installed GNU sed through homebrew and added the sed command on the PATH without the g-prefix. I prefer GNU sed over the BSD sed that macOS comes preinstalled with.

The command that cause the error:

sed_hyphen_i -e 's/WITH_JEMALLOC = True/WITH_JEMALLOC = False/' tensorflow/core/platform/default/build_config.bzl

This is because this function only checks if the command is running on macOS and then assumes the sed that it is running is BSD sed.

This is not the same as #8935 because that issue just addresses that most of the time sed on macOS is BSD sed, but doesn't address that sometimes it can also be GNU sed.
body_text:

The command that cause the error:
sed_hyphen_i -e 's/WITH_JEMALLOC = True/WITH_JEMALLOC = False/' tensorflow/core/platform/default/build_config.bzl

This is because this function only checks if the command is running on macOS and then assumes the sed that it is running is BSD sed.
This is not the same as #8935 because that issue just addresses that most of the time sed on macOS is BSD sed, but doesn't address that sometimes it can also be GNU sed.
body:
I installed GNU sed through homebrew and added the sed command on the PATH without the g-prefix. I prefer GNU sed over the BSD sed that macOS comes preinstalled with. 

The command that cause the error:
```
sed_hyphen_i -e 's/WITH_JEMALLOC = True/WITH_JEMALLOC = False/' tensorflow/core/platform/default/build_config.bzl
```

This is because this function only checks if the command is running on macOS and then assumes the sed that it is running is BSD sed.

This is not the same as #8935 because that issue just addresses that most of the time sed on macOS is BSD sed, but doesn't address that sometimes it can also be GNU sed.
